entry.title: Pashinyan orders Armenian officials to refrain from visiting Belarus, as relations nosedive

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan orders Armenian officials to refrain from visiting Belarus, as relations nosedive
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan once again indicated he plans to take Armenia out of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a Russian-led military alliance, though he stopped short of formally announcing a withdrawal or providing any timeline. üìç Pashinyan ordered all Armenian officials not to visit Belarus, a close Russian ally. üìç The United States reiterated its support for an Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal.

entry.title: Digital transformation: How IT talent can thrive with Ameriabank

Davit Hovhannisyan, chief information officer at Ameriabank, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about his decision to repatriate to Armenia and continue his career at one of Armenia‚Äôs leading financial institutions after nearly 30 years overseas. They also discuss Ameriabank‚Äôs digital transformation and the need to improve human resource processes in Armenia‚Äôs burgeoning IT sector.

media:group.media:description:
Le 12 juin, la police anti-√©meute arm√©nienne a tir√© des grenades assourdissantes sur des manifestants anti-gouvernementaux devant le b√¢timent du Parlement √† Erevan.
Des milliers de manifestants faisaient le piquet pour exiger la d√©mission du Premier ministre Nikol Pachinian.
La tension entre les forces de police et les manifestants a augment√©. Les deux camps se sont bouscul√©s puis une bagarre a √©clat√©. Les forces de s√©curit√© ont tir√© plus d'une vingtaine de grenades assourdissantes quelques instants plus tard, blessant un peu plus de cent manifestants ainsi qu'au moins deux journalistes. Des ambulances sont arriv√©es sur place pour prodiguer les premiers soins √† certains d'entre eux.

entry.title: Anti-government protesters in Armenia injured as police use flash grenades

media:group.media:title: Anti-government protesters in Armenia injured as police use flash grenades
media:group.media:description:
üìç Protesters attempting to blockade the prime minister inside the parliament building are met with flash grenades by police. üìç Armenia and the United States agree to upgrade their relations from a strategic dialogue to a strategic partnership and sign a customs agreement. üìç Pashinyan congratulates Putin on the Russia Day holiday, and tells reporters Armenia will at some point leave the Russian-led CSTO alliance.

’à’Ω’ø’´’Ø’°’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’® ‘±’¶’£’°’µ’´’∂ ’™’∏’≤’∏’æ’´ ’¥’∏’ø ’∞’°’æ’°÷Ñ’æ’°’Æ ÷Å’∏÷Ç÷Å’°÷Ä’°÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’æ÷Ä’° ’¨’∏÷Ç’Ω’°’±’°’µ’∂’°’µ’´’∂ ’∂’º’∂’°’Ø’∂’•÷Ä ’Ø’´÷Ä’°’º’•÷Å÷â ’è’•’≤’´ ’∏÷Ç’∂’•÷Å’°’Æ ’´÷Ä’°’§’°÷Ä’±’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø÷á’°’∂÷Ñ’∏’æ ’¢’∏÷Ç’™÷Ö’£’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’ß ’§’´’¥’•’¨ 55 ’°’∂’±÷â ‘∫’°’¥’® 21:00-’´ ’§÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’¥’¢ ’¢’•÷Ä’¥’°’∂ ’•’∂’©’°÷Ä’Ø’æ’°’Æ 86 ’°’∂’± ’Ø’°÷â ’à’Ω’ø’´’Ø’°’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’® ’∞’°’µ’ø’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ’∂’°÷á ’æ’•÷Å ’æ’´÷Ä’°’æ’∏÷Ä ’∏’Ω’ø’´’Ø’°’∂’´ ’¥’°’Ω’´’∂÷â
Police in Armenia used stun grenades on anti-government protesters gathered near the National Assembly in Armenia Wednesday evening. Protesters attempted to blockade the prime minister inside the parliament building. Thirty people were injured and 86 others detained as of 9pm local time. According to police, six officers were injured.
Demonstrations in Armenia have been on-going over the last few week‚Äôs over the government‚Äôs proposed border deal with Azerbaijan.
